title: Thunderbird Won't Open Window in Default Profile (1 of 3), But Will In Troubleshoot Mode
content:
Running Thunderbird ("TB") 102.14.0 (32-bit) in Windows 10 in a mini-tower PC.

TB will not open a window in the default profile, but will in the two other profiles. This began happening after being left unattended for several hours and t

TB will open a window in Troubleshooting Mode. While in Troubleshooting mode, I deleted an extension that was out of date in the default profile, but that did not solve the problem.

TB works fine in the other two profiles (in regular mode).

I've searched for a solution, but nothing helps.

Thanks for any help. This happened two months ago, but I was sick with Covid then, and could not focus mentally.
creator: charles16

title: Thunderbird Supernova
content:
I've been using Thunderbird Supernova since it became available to the public and the changes are absolutely fantastic! Thanks and kudos to all those involved!

I'm a long-time user of Thunderbird (decades) but haven't been a big fan of the preview pane. That's just me. However, with the advent of Supernova, I decided to turn on the preview pane particularly since you added the Card View feature. I use the "Vertical" layout with folders, messages and then the preview pane on the right.

Perhaps I'm just not in the know but is there an ability to open a message in a new tab from the preview pane? I looked at customizing the toolbars but didn't find an "Open" message button. I thought that double-clicking in the preview pane would open the message in a new tab but alas it doesn't do anything. I also right-clicked in the preview pane and there was no option on that menu to open the message either.

Even though I use my 55" TV for my monitor, I don't give the preview pane 100% capability to view the entire width of a message because I want to see more of the subject in the message column and a complete date and time. It's very clear that not all messages are created equally so some wrap and fit nicely and other won't wrap and the slider bars appear. I'm good with how this works. So when I'm using the slider bars in the preview pane there are times I want to open the message in a new tab to more readily read the larger message. I hope this makes sense. Thus my need to be able to open a message from the preview pane either by double-clicking or by using a button in the preview pane. And, BTW, my "General" settings are set to open a message in a new tab when double-clicked. I prefer to work from tabs (another very nice feature!).

If this feature doesn't exist then I would appreciate it if you would consider adding it and a button at the top of the preview pane panel to open a message in a new tab.

I'll look forward to your reply.

Kindest regards,

Ken Cox [removed email from public]
creator: starphyter

title: Certain senders' emails always go to junk in spite of filters to prevent it
content:
In one of my email accounts, there are a couple of senders whose emails always go to junk mail, no matter how many filters I set up to try to prevent it. For example, messages from one of them always have 'WKCC' included in the Subject line, and 'members2members' in the To line. I've set up innumerable filters based on those features, checking 'Manually Run' and 'Getting New Mail', choosing to filter before or after Junk Classification, and choosing to move the message to the Inbox. I've also tried choosing to apply the filter 'Periodically, every 10 minutes'. In every case, after setting up the filter, when I click on 'Run Now', the junk mail is correctly moved to the Inbox, and it stays there. But future messages are NEVER correctly prevented from going to the Junk Email folder, nor are messages in the junk folder processed every 10 minutes when I request that.

I'm at a loss, any help would be greatly appreciated!

-Paul
creator: murtaugp

title: Defaust search engine Thunderbird email settings

When I click on a hyperlink in an email, nothing happens. Is there a different URL I can use? Thanks.

title: Feature Idea: Zooming the Thunderbird Calendar
content:
Hi there,

I don't know if this is the best place to post an idea for Mozilla Thunderbird. For a long time I have been looking for a feature that would allow me to fit more time on one page of my calendar (in week view). I recently discovered the correct setting to change the number of hours displayed.

I've always tried using Ctrl+Mouse Wheel to zoom in and out, but it didn't change anything. I thought it would be a nice idea to map the above setting to the Ctrl+Wheel combination for zooming in and out, so you don't have to search through the settings.

Do you have any experience with this or is there an addon for this?

Thanks in advance
creator: survellow

title: Moved Folders in Thunderbird; now Thunderbird deletes them secodns after opening
content:
I have been using Thunderbird for years without any major issues. I started yesterday receiving a message that it could not write emails due to not enough space, etc. A lot of searching on the web and it seemed the best solution was to re-add my gmail account as an IMAP account rather than POP, which I did. Emails now worked correctly coming in.

I have a large number of folders organizing my emails under my original profile. Within Firefox, I moved them from my POP email to my IMAP email. I waited to make sure this was done successfully, as it would count through them at the bottom of the screen. Once this was done, I deleted the POP account.

Today, I opened Thunderbird and a lot of the folders are missing. The internet has been very little help, but I did manage to locate them in the Mail folder of the profile folders. If I move them to the corresponding location in the ImapMail folder (the msf and the file with no extension) they show up for a second in Thunderbird, then not just disappear, they are literally deleted from my hard drive.

Please help me get these emails back. Even if I have to find some way to make them readable outside of Thunderbird, that's fine. These are records I need to have access to.

It should not take rocket science to move a folder and I am seriously considering a different client now.
creator: Sinaku

title: Can receive but cannot send emails
content:
Over the last 6 months or so, failures to send email were occurring sporadically with Thunderbird for my wife's account with Comcast. Hitting the retry button on the popup or clicking the x button would at times result in sending the email. Presently, this does not work, nor does the option of entering the password when the prompt occurs during attempted sends.

Current version of TB is 115.2.2 (64-bit). SMTP port is 465, normal password and SSL/TLS and protocol is POP.

I have other email accounts that work correctly with comcast as POP and Imap in my accounts on several Windows 11 computers. My wife's account otherwise works correctly with Comcast's email tool accessed through a browser. In the log file above, "username" is substituted for the actual user name.

Please interpret what is happening and advise what actions might be appropriate to resolve the problem sending email with Thunderbird.
